poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for The Ambassador Program (MIP55c3-SP7) - September 12, 2022

discourse_list.title: MIP55c3-SP7: Special Purpose Fund for The Ambassador Program

content.content: MIP55c3-SP7: Special Purpose Fund for The Ambassador Program  Preamble MIP55c3-SP#: 7 Author(s): @kat  Contributors: @sebix @Joserjimz Tags: spf Status: Accepted Date Proposed: 2022-08-10 Date Ratified: 2022-09-26 Amount Requested: 81,000 DAI Recipient Address: Multisig address will be added after successful on-chain vote prior to the executive vote. Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip55c3-sp7-special-purpose-fund-for-the-ambassador-program/17169 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmcJQCyW   Sentence Summary This subproposal aims to allocate 81,000 DAI to the Ambassador Program.  Paragraph Summary The MakerDAO Ambassador program provides non-English speaking communities with resources and educational materials to expand the MakerDAO community. Ambassadors provide two-way translation services, engage their communities with local events, and share content produced in their language with the MakerDAO community.  Motivation This Special Purpose Fund aims to finance the ongoing work and projects of the Ambassador Program.  1727×390 311 KB   Special Purpose Fund Name Ambassador Program Special Purpose Fund.  Special Purpose Fund Scope & Work Credentials There is a huge amount of potential for MakerDAO in non-English speaking communities and a lack of educational resources as well as means for these community members to participate.  The Ambassador Program allows for these communities to engage with MakerDAO—bringing us a new wave of community members, developers, talent, and MKR holders. The Ambassador Program has kept the LATAM community updated regarding the progress and achievements of the MakerDAO Protocol through weekly translations of the most critical updates:  Weekly Relay Forum at Glance The Weekly Polls The Monthly Core Unit Updates   Evergreen Material The Ambassadors has also been translating essential parts of the Protocol documentation, including translating and maintaining the Maker Operational Manual in Spanish and the MakerDOCs in Spanish, as well as some relevant MIPs.  Maker Operational Manual The Maker Operational Manual is an ongoing project by GovAlpha. New pages are translated and old ones are subject to revision periodically. Here’s the official announcement of the Maker Operational Manual in Spanish to the community.  1285×427 49.3 KB   MakerDOCs The MakerDOCs documents have been translated in a titanic quest from the Ambassador Program. With some gaps to fill, 95% of the DOCS has been fully translated and uploaded for the community. You can check the announcement of the MakerDOCs in Spanish in the LATAM part of the Forum.  1439×625 76.7 KB   Ambassadors Setting Foot on Twitter In addition, the Ambassador Program has been working on positioning the Maker brand for Spanish-speaking audiences through the official account on Twitter in Spanish. It has been publishing content about:  Ongoing or completed debates and votes that have been most relevant to the Protocol. Updates about advances and achievements (such as the Maker Teleport and the Multichain Strategy). Educational content explaining how the DAI stability mechanisms work, how the Oracles work, the Settlements, etc. Maker partnerships with other projects inside and outside the crypto ecosystem and participation in various events and hackathons.   Twitter Metrics     Month Metrics Twitter Analytics     August 01 - 07 Tweets: 64. Impressions: 20,300. Views: 2,265. Mentions: 07. New Followers: 16.   1639×601 28.6 KB   983×711 27.6 KB     July Tweets: 188. Impressions: 25,900. Views: 7,464. Mentions: 46. New Followers: 40.   1646×588 29.3 KB   984×708 28.5 KB     June Tweets: 272. Impressions: 62,800. Views: 17,600. Mentions: 130. New Followers: 223.   1635×577 26.6 KB   982×703 29.9 KB     May Tweets: 286. Impressions: 64,000. Views: 15,900. Mentions: 84. New Followers: 248   1647×588 28.1 KB   985×709 30 KB     April Tweets: 185. Impressions: 219,000. Views: 15,500. Mentions: 121. New Followers: 395.   1642×583 27.7 KB   982×706 28.8 KB     March Tweets: 169. Impressions: 27,000. Views: 16,000. Mentions: 69. New Followers: 146  980×709 27.3 KB     Note: Thanks to @tobal and his work with the official MakerDAO account and the MakerGrowth account.  Increased Activity of the LATAM Community The presence of the community in the forum has been noticeable, and more discussions have been presented in Spanish. While participating fully in the forum involves a particular learning curve for new users, several have contributed a lot to the forum.      1040×748 61.1 KB   1037×753 61.5 KB       1031×767 61.9 KB   1053×751 62.8 KB      2022 So Far… Since the Ambassador Program started, we have seen a significant increase in the number of LATAM users and topics on the Top SourceCred earner’s list. Currently, the top post of 2022 is a LATAM post. For the following information, the selected interval was: January 1, 2022 to August 9, 2022  — Source: MakerDAO SourceCred Stats  (2 Latam posts on Top 10 Topics by Cred Generated, including #1)  (3 Latam members on Top 10 Cred Earners)  Meet-ups & Social Gatherings To generate and consolidate communities around Maker, the Program has been participating in different spaces, on- and offline, positioning the DAI name and explaining how Maker works. These participations range from private communities using tools such as Google Meet or Zoom to Public Spaces on Twitter, where any user can listen in, participate, ask questions, and talk about the Protocol—encouraging the debate and discussion around Maker. As of this day, the Ambassador Program has participated in over eight different meet-ups and social gatherings, both on- and offline. It has been possible to attend hackathons in the region and have a presence in offline communities and regional events, making the Protocol known not only through online media but through word of mouth and sharing with members of other communities.  Defiant             486×1080 35 KB   486×1080 34.3 KB   486×1080 31.5 KB      De-Fi LATAM Telegram - MakerDAO              3358×1782 484 KB   762×1276 95.6 KB   784×1468 101 KB   750×1348 95.9 KB      Revelation Hackathon            748×1000 62.7 KB   748×1000 75.2 KB      Ethereum Caracas            960×1280 168 KB   3000×4000 2.76 MB      Twitter Spaces  CryptoProde              486×1080 42.8 KB   486×1080 39.4 KB   486×1080 40.2 KB   486×1080 36.8 KB      ExploranDAO #1 - MakerDAO             486×1080 40.8 KB   486×1080 39 KB   486×1080 35.6 KB      MakerDAO - LATAM            486×1080 41.8 KB   486×1080 38.6 KB      Growing a Healthy Community One of the Ambassador Program’s goals is to create a healthy, productive environment for the MakerDAO community. The Ambassadors have been managing and leading a Telegram group, building and developing a robust Spanish-speaking community, and giving them resources to overcome the learning curve preventing them from participating in the Protocol. This work can be seen in the Translations Assignment Sheet where our community members can translate new material the Program cannot cover, due to staffing, in an orderly manner. Noteworthy, in this group, there are multiple discussions about topics related to DAI and Maker, such as news, implementations, use cases, projects involving the Protocol, and discussions about what is happening in the crypto ecosystem, DeFi, and the Maker Forum.  What’s Next for the Ambassador Program? This funding allows the continuation of the work that the Ambassador Program has been developing in terms of community, brand positioning, and presence in the Spanish-speaking market. The Ambassador Program aims to provide new Spanish users with all the Maker content they need, expanding the reach of the Protocol’s current and future products, breaking down the language barrier, and taking the Protocol to new audiences. For this budget cycle, we are expanding the team to add two part-time ambassadors to allow for more translation and original content production.  Above and Beyond In the future, we would like to expand the Ambassador Program to other regions such as Asia and Eastern Europe to provide non-English educational materials and further build and grow the Maker community.  Funding Breakdown The following is a summary of the Ambassadors Program 6-month budget outlining how the funds will be used.     TEAM DAI     Kat 12,000 DAI   Sebix 24,000 DAI   Jose 24,000 DAI   Part-time Ambassador 7,500 DAI   Part-time Ambassador 7,500 DAI   Devcon ETH Bogota 4,500 DAI   Softwares or Licenses 1,500 DAI   Total 81,000 DAI     Special Purpose Fund Details Official Contact or Group Name: @Sebix Contact Email/Handle: [email protected] / @Sebix Date Added: (2022-08-10) Total Amount: 81,000 DAI Wallet Address: 0xF411d823a48D18B32e608274Df16a9957fE33E45 Comptroller signers: @tadeo, @Davidutro
content.GPT-summary: The post is a proposal for allocating 81,000 DAI to the MakerDAO Ambassador Program, which aims to provide non-English speaking communities with resources and educational materials to expand the MakerDAO community. The proposal explains the scope and work credentials of the program, its motivation, and funding breakdown. The post also includes entirely positive feedback on the program's achievements and contributions from third parties, as well as advertising the program's presence on Twitter and its future plans.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal
None

content.content: This is an application for a Special Purpose Fund as detailed in MIP55. It requests a transfer of 81,000 DAI which will be used to fund the ongoing work of the Ambassador Program. A 6-month budget breakdown is provided. GovAlpha is satisfied these specific and temporary objectives meet the requirement to qualify for an SPF. While this is the second funding request for the program it is limited to six months in length and subject to approval by MKR holders. To proceed to an on-chain vote, the applicant will need to identify a minimum of two comptrollers as defined in MIP55. Because this request is for more than 50,000 DAI, the proposal will enter the monthly governance cycle.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party advertising proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: kat:

The Maker DeFi LatAm community has grown tremendously since the inception of the previous MIP55 application and 3F Delegate will continue to support the growth of a region that can provide tremendous growth for DAI and a region that is today hungrier than ever  to participate in this ecosystem. I urge @Recognized-Delegates and MKR token owners to continue supporting this Ambassador Program that is educating non-English speaking communities on the value of both DAI and MakerDAO. The South American region is one that is currently being target by some of the largest Centralized Crypto Exchanges in the world. Do not allow MakerDAO to be excluded out of the exponential growth that will occur is both Central and South America. Support this SPF for the continued growth of the Ambassador Program.

content.content: Thank you for the work you’re doing here. Fully support the Ambassador program. That being said, we’d love to see the quality of submissions go up substantially. Maker needs to go conquer the world. Quality is how it’s done. Otherwise this program will always have to answer to accusations of source cred farming.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: I strongly support any initiative in which Latin America is recognized as a potential competitor for exposure to Maker and DAI, in a previous topic I was invited to participate in DM to give ideas for this exposure to be applied, but it would really need a well-established structure therefore I couldn’t interact.     Growth CU - APAC Regional Update - Q2 2022 Growth       Thank you for your comment. And you are right, most of the chinese exchanges I spoke to now know that DAI is widely adopted in Argentina because of the inroad the team in Argentina built years ago. We also spoke to Bybit which expanded to Argentina recently. And the strategic thing to do is to partner up with all these big exchanges expanding into LATAM to push DAI by running some strategic marketing activation and educational campaigns. Feel free to dm me if you have other ideas in mind.     But this is a clear example of a job well done, entering a growing region early is getting ahead, and the ambassador program is a clear example of this, perseverance, discipline and courage. As a Latin American I am forced to change all my benefits from local currency to stable currency, as documented I use DAI as I do there are thousands of people who escape the inflation of their country, but undocumented people use DAI out of simple ignorance, if we were to more people that would change.  cepalstat_chart_16602181065161809×1677 306 KB  The PIB in Latin America is increasing since the constant hyperinflations are transformed into inflation and the average citizen looks for the escape to stronger currencies (when depositing your local currency in banks they remove an exaggerated commission) in addition to the fact that there is not enough circulation of dollars to To support the desire of the majority of citizens, therefore, they resort to stable currencies. If we managed to get these citizens to deposit at least 1,000 DAI, which would be almost 25% of their annual PIB, we would be cleanly increasing the fluid liquidity of DAI, and this would be achieved by making DAI is recognized as USDT did, and the Ambassadors team is the living example that it can be achieved

content.content: Hey guys, happy to see an ambassadors program in Latam, is something Mariano, Luis, and I started in the times of the Foundation intending to help people in Latam to know more about DAI and Maker. At that time that was important because the crypto community in Latam was mainly BTC and DASH!!! the ethereum ecosystem was minimum and there were only a few exchanges with DAI. But that’s different now  communities have evolved considerably and you can find groups like DeFi Latam! I think the latam ambassadors program has to reflect that evolution, although translations are nice, it’s also important to generate localized content, explaining to people in each country why Dai should matter to them, why an open governance protocol is a game changer, and relevant in countries with high corruption rates. Original and localized content is important and I would completely support it because we could work together and have a huge impact through that. My DMs are open if you want to discuss how we can work together!

content.content: This is a great example of how Project-Based Budgeting could work. While we haven’t gotten yet to the part of working on the templates, maybe including milestones would be great to help the @Recognized-Delegates scope the work.

content.content: I strongly support the ambassador program and the work that @Sebix and @Joserjimz are doing in LATAM, where the growth of the community has been very strong and organic. There is much more to do in the region, there is a lot of potential and DAI adoption can grow even more due to high inflation and recurring economic problems and the solutions that stablecoins provide to people. I´m very enthusiastic about MakerDAO, I have collaborated with spanish translations in the forum, I ´m also an IP lawyer and an active participant in the crypto community in Argentina, so you can count on me for whatever you need to strengthen the growth of the ambassador program and the MakerDAO protocol.

content.content: I am submitting this MIP for Formal Submission to the September governance cycle.
Hey @kat wanted to confirm if you would be using the same multisig wallet as last time? This would be appropriate if @Davidutro and @tadeo still wish to be the comptrollers.

content.content: We will be using the same multisig and thank you to @Davidutro and @tadeo !
Excellent if you could post your confirmation here David and Tadeo we can have it included in next week’s Executive
I confirm my willingness to be a comptroller of the Ambassador Program multi-sig @kat @prose11
I confirm my willingness to be a comptroller of the Ambassador Program multi-sig @kat @prose11
